creator: trawick@apache.org
text:
Example log message:

[Mon Oct 19 16:30:10 2009] [info] [client 127.0.0.1] (11)Resource temporarily unavailable: mod_fcgid: error writing data, FastCGI server closed connection

This occurs in fcgid_proc_unix::socket_writev() after poll reports that the socket is writable.

Perhaps there is a system-wide buffer shortage, or AF_UNIX sockets act like pipes in that buffers < PIPE_BUF must be written atomically?  For the latter, the EAGAIN handling for pipes in apr_file_write() for Unix may be needed.

The issue has been seen by me on Solaris (OpenSolaris 2009.06), but others have reported it in the past (with no solution), so I'm assuming this problem is multi-platform for the time being.
